lead_paragraph: A new course trains police officers to intervene when they see colleagues engaging in unethical behavior.

headline.print_headline: With Eye on Reform, New Orleans Is Training Officers to Police One Another
headline.main: New Orleans Program Teaches Officers to Police One Another

snippet: A new course trains police officers to intervene when they see colleagues engaging in unethical behavior....
abstract: New Orleans Police Depr, under national scrutiny following highly-publicized cases of misconduct, institutes innovative training program that focuses on preparing officers to police each other by stepping in before unethical behavior happens; program is also unique in that it was developed from within the department, aided by work of psychology professor Ervin Staub, whose survival in Budapest during World War II pushed him to spend his career studying group violence and virtues of intervention.
